intro: Cypella armosa, commonly known as the slender cypella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cypella armosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky slopes.
